qas.question: In what year did Mali get a new constitution?
In January of 1991 what type of protests were violently curbed?
What type of administration did general Mousa Traoré have?
Strict rules were put in place to appease what monetary fund?
It was rumored that people close to the government lived in what type of condition?
Opposition to who grew during the 1990s?
Who lead violent protests in January 1991?
Who is subject to mass arrests in the 1980s?

context: <b5_0>Anti-government protests<b5_0/> in <a0_0>1991<a0_0/> led to a coup, a transitional government, and a new constitution. Opposition to the corrupt and <a2_0>dictatorial regime<a2_0/> of <b6_0>General Moussa Traoré<b6_0/> grew during the 1980s. During this time strict programs, imposed to satisfy demands of the <a3_0>International Monetary Fund<a3_0/>, brought increased hardship upon the country's population, while elites close to the government supposedly lived in <a4_0>growing wealth<a4_0/>. Peaceful <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0>student<b8_0/><b7_0/> protests<a1_0/> in January 1991 were brutally suppressed, with mass arrests and torture of leaders and participants. Scattered acts of rioting and vandalism of public buildings followed, but most actions by the <b9_0>dissidents<b9_0/> remained nonviolent.
